title: New Samsung Flip Phone (2018): W2019 release date, specs and price
description: ![Samsung flipphone]()Image Credit: MySmartPriceEarlier still, a Wi-Fi Alliance listing for the SM-W2019 was spotted, whichrevealed that while Samsung’s 2019 flip phone will ship with the older[Android 8.0 Oreo](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/android-8-0-oreo)operating system, it will support the future-facing[802.11ac](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinion/802-11ac-vs-802-11n-what-s-the-difference-2905251) Wi-Fi standard (now known as [Wi-Fi6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/what-is-wi-fi-6-new-wi-fi-names-3598675)), which suggests the presence of a new-gen SoC under the hood –Qualcomm’s [Snapdragon845](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/snapdragon-845-benchmark-phones-speed-3390981) being the likeliest chip to feature.As a further idea of what to expect from the Samsung W2019 flip phone, lastyear’s W2018 sported a pair of Full HD AMOLED display measuring 4.2 incheseach. Given that device offered a 12-megapixel primary camera spec similar(but not identical) to Samsung’s 2017 flagships, it wouldn’t be a surprise tosee the W2019 come with two 12-megapixel rear sensors, as dual camera setupsare now very much in vogue.An upgraded 8-megapixel front ‘selfie cam’ has also been mooted, but as ever,these specs are purely conjuncture at this stage – we hope to learn more soon.One final thing to note is that last year’s Samsung flip phone wasn’t overlyaffordable. Its price cleared the £1000 mark when converted from yuan, meaningyou could likely bag a [GalaxyS9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/samsung-galaxy-s9) or [iPhoneXS](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/iphone-xs) for a similar outlay.Plus, the W20118 only appears to have been released in China, so you might notbe able to buy one, even if you wanted to.Still, Samsung’s next premium flip phone could well offer some clues as towhat to expect from its next mainstream releases, so we’re intrigued.Watch this space.**Should Samsung release a premium flip phone in the UK? Let us know over onTwitter @TrustedReviews.**
